solveminmax.minmax_term module¶

class solveminmax.minmax_term.MinMaxTerm(minmax_term)¶

Bases: object

The MinMaxTerm class.

Variables

  • _operator (str) – The operator of the minmax terms.

  • _coef (str) – The coefficients for minmax terms.

  • _minmax_op (str) – Min or max operator of minmax terms.

  • _minmax_tuple (str) – A string of tuple, such as (30, 30*a).

coef()¶

Get the coefficient of minmax terms.

Examples

>>> minmax_term = ('+', '2', 'min', '(400, 400*a)')
>>> a = MinMaxTerm(minmax_term)
>>> a.operator()
'2'
Returns

The coefficient of the minmax term.

Return type

str

left_right_half()¶

Get the left and right half from minmax tuple.

Examples

>>> minmax_term = ('+', '2', 'min', '(400, 400*a)')
>>> a = MinMaxTerm(minmax_term)
>>> a.left_right_half()
('400', '400*a')
Returns

The left and right string in minmax tuple.

Return type

tuple

left_right_nums()¶

Get the left and right numbers in minmax tuple.

Examples

>>> minmax_term = ('+', '2', 'min', '(400, 400*a)')
>>> a = MinMaxTerm(minmax_term)
>>> a.left_right_nums()
(400.0, 400.0)
Returns

tuple containing left and right float numbers.

Return type

tuple

minmax_op()¶

Get the minmax operator (whether min or max)

Returns

The minmax operator.

Return type

str

minmax_tuple()¶

Get the minmax tuple.

Returns

The minmax tuple.

Return type

str

operator()¶

Get the operator.

Examples

>>> minmax_term = ('+', '', 'min', '(400, 400*a)')
>>> a = MinMaxTerm(minmax_term)
>>> a.operator()
'+'
Returns

The minmax operator.

Return type

str
